online.learnTrading: Learn serious trading as a beginner in just 7 days and start your day trading career
online.description2: With our step-by-step guide, actionable tips, broker recommendations, chart analyses, and a proven strategy, you'll lay the foundation for long-term profitable trading and financial freedom. Get our free trading education now in PDF format and seize the opportunity to take your trading knowledge to the next level, including a free beginner consultation from a trading specialist!
online.lifeChange: How successful trading will change your
online.timeInvestment: With just 30-60 minutes of time a day!
online.successTrader: Become a successful trader in just 7 days
online.successTrader1: Become a successful trader in just 7 days
online.technicalAnalysis: Learn the basics of technical analysis and market observation to understand the development of a stock.
online.riskManagementDescription: We'll show you what proper risk management looks like in practice and how to protect your capital from unnecessary losses.
online.checklistDefinition: Here we show you how to define clear entry and exit points using our checklist. With this strategy, you can then create and implement your own trading ideas.
online.incomeLimits: There are no income limits in trading. We'll show you what factors determine your first 100,000 €.
online.wantToLearnNewSkills: You want to learn new skills
online.wantFinancialFreedom: You want to achieve financial freedom
online.readyToInvest: You are ready to invest 250€ for your first trades
online.willingToLearn: You are eager to learn and trust our trading strategies
online.notInterested: You are not interested in trading
online.notWillingToLearn: You are not willing to learn
online.noMoneyToInvest: You don't want to invest money
online.noTimeToInvest: You don't want to invest time
online.dayTradingTrainingDescription:
In this 7-day training, you will learn the basics of day trading in an easy-to-understand and entertaining way, divided into 7 compact chapters. You will receive clear instructions and strategies that you can confidently implement on your own.

With over 15 years of experience as a trader, I have learned many valuable lessons – but I have also made mistakes. I know how complex trading can be for beginners. To make it as easy as possible for you to get started, I have developed this free online training, exactly what I wish I had had back then. Additionally, we offer you an optional phone coaching session with one of our trading experts, who will introduce you to trading and our proven strategies.
Your Tim
online.learnIn7Steps: You will learn how to trade profitably in just 7 steps with our method within the next 7 days.
online.cfBrokerSelection: Learn what to look for when choosing the right CFD broker and what the biggest difference is to trading with leverage.
online.tradingPlatformsIntro: You will get an introduction to the 2 most common trading platforms so you feel confident and know exactly what to look out for.
online.transformYourselfToAdvanced: Transform yourself from a complete beginner to an advanced trader in just a few days. Don’t wait any longer and secure our trading PDF for this unique and free online training now.
online.riskNoticeDetails: Trading leveraged products (e.g., CFDs and forex trades) or other financial instruments carries significant risk and is not suitable for everyone. There is a possibility that you may suffer a total loss or even losses that exceed your investments. Before trading leveraged products or other financial instruments, you should ensure that you fully understand all the associated risks. In addition, we refer to our risk notices. It is expressly clarified that we do not offer or provide investment advice and in particular do not make any specific recommendations regarding a security, financial product, or instrument. The mention of specific securities or investment products does not constitute a recommendation to buy, sell, or hold them. You trade or invest at your own risk. Any liability is excluded.
online.title: We take privacy seriously! This privacy policy was created by specialist lawyers.
online.desc2: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal data when you visit this website. Personal data is any data by which you can be personally identified. For detailed information on data protection, please refer to our privacy policy listed below this text.
online.desc4: Who is responsible for the data collection on this website?
online.desc5: The data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. The contact details of the operator can be found in the website’s imprint.
online.desc6: How do we collect your data?
online.desc7: Your data is collected on the one hand by you providing it to us. This can be, for example, data that you enter in a contact form.
online.desc8: Other data is collected automatically by our IT systems when you visit the website. These are mainly technical data (e.g., internet browser, operating system, or time of the page visit). The collection of this data occurs automatically as soon as you enter this website.
online.desc9: What do we use your data for?
online.desc10: Part of the data is collected to ensure error-free provision of the website. Other data can be used to analyze your user behavior.
online.desc11: What rights do you have regarding your data?
online.desc12: You have the right to obtain information about the origin, recipients, and purpose of your stored personal data at any time, free of charge. You also have the right to request the correction or deletion of this data. You can contact us at any time at the address given in the imprint for further questions on the subject of data protection. Furthermore, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.
online.desc13: You also have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data under certain circumstances. For details, please refer to the privacy policy under 'Right to Restrict Processing.'
online.desc15: When you visit this website, your browsing behavior may be statistically analyzed. This happens primarily with cookies and so-called analytics programs. The analysis of your browsing behavior is usually anonymous; browsing behavior cannot be traced back to you.
online.desc16: You can object to this analysis or prevent it by not using certain tools. Detailed information on these tools and your options for objection can be found in the following privacy policy.
online.desc20: This website is hosted by an external service provider (host). Personal data collected on this website is stored on the host’s servers. This may include, but is not limited to, IP addresses, contact requests, meta and communication data, contract data, contact details, names, website access, and other data generated through a website.
online.desc21: The use of the host is for the purpose of fulfilling our contract with potential and existing customers (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR) and in the interest of secure, fast, and efficient provision of our online services by a professional provider (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR).
online.desc22: Our host will only process your data to the extent necessary to fulfill its service obligations and will follow our instructions regarding this data.
online.desc23: Conclusion of a data processing agreement
online.desc24: To ensure data protection-compliant processing, we have concluded a contract for data processing with our host.
online.desc27: The operators of these pages take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.
online.desc28: When you use this website, various personal data are collected. Personal data are data with which you can be personally identified. This privacy policy explains what data we collect and what we use it for. It also explains how and for what purpose this happens.
online.desc29: We would like to point out that data transmission over the internet (e.g., when communicating via email) can have security vulnerabilities. Complete protection of the data from access by third parties is not possible.
online.desc31: The responsible party for data processing on this website is: TF Daytrading GmbH
online.desc36: The responsible party is the natural or legal person who, alone or together with others, decides on the purposes and means of processing personal data (e.g., names, email addresses, etc.).
online.desc37: Revocation of your consent to data processing
online.desc38: Many data processing operations are only possible with your express consent. You can revoke any previously given consent at any time. An informal notification via email to us is sufficient. The legality of the data processing carried out until the revocation remains unaffected by the revocation.
online.desc39: Right to object to data collection in special cases and to direct advertising (Art. 21 GDPR)
online.desc40: IF THE DATA PROCESSING IS BASED ON ART. 6 PARA. 1 LIT. E OR F GDPR, YOU HAVE THE RIGHT TO OBJECT TO THE PROCESSING OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA AT ANY TIME FOR REASONS ARISING FROM YOUR PARTICULAR SITUATION; THIS ALSO APPLIES TO PROFILING BASED ON THESE PROVISIONS. THE RESPECTIVE LEGAL BASIS ON WHICH PROCESSING IS BASED CAN BE FOUND IN THIS PRIVACY POLICY. IF YOU OBJECT, WE WILL NO LONGER PROCESS YOUR AFFECTED PERSONAL DATA UNLESS WE CAN DEMONSTRATE COMPELLING LEGITIMATE GROUNDS FOR THE PROCESSING THAT OVERRIDE YOUR INTERESTS, RIGHTS, AND FREEDOMS, OR THE PROCESSING SERVES THE ASSERTION, EXERCISE, OR DEFENSE OF LEGAL CLAIMS (OBJECTION PURSUANT TO ART. 21 PARA. 1 GDPR).
online.desc41: IF YOUR PERSONAL DATA IS PROCESSED FOR DIRECT ADVERTISING PURPOSES, YOU HAVE THE RIGHT TO OBJECT AT ANY TIME TO THE PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA CONCERNING YOU FOR SUCH ADVERTISING; THIS ALSO APPLIES TO PROFILING INSOFAR AS IT IS RELATED TO SUCH DIRECT ADVERTISING. IF YOU OBJECT, YOUR PERSONAL DATA WILL NO LONGER BE USED FOR DIRECT ADVERTISING PURPOSES (OBJECTION PURSUANT TO ART. 21 PARA. 2 GDPR).
online.desc42: Right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority
online.desc43: In the event of violations of the GDPR, the persons concerned have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, in particular in the member state of their habitual residence, workplace, or the place of the alleged violation. The right to lodge a complaint is without prejudice to other administrative or judicial remedies.
online.desc45: You have the right to have data that we process based on your consent or in fulfillment of a contract automatically delivered to yourself or to a third party in a standard, machine-readable format. If you request the direct transfer of the data to another responsible party, this will only take place to the extent that it is technically feasible.
online.desc47: This site uses SSL or TLS encryption for security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content, such as orders or inquiries that you send to us as the site operator. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the fact that the address line of the browser changes from 'http://' to 'https://' and by the lock symbol in your browser line.
online.desc48: If SSL or TLS encryption is activated, the data you transmit to us cannot be read by third parties.
online.desc50: Within the scope of the applicable legal provisions, you have the right to obtain information about your stored personal data, its origin, and recipients, the purpose of the data processing, and, if applicable, a right to correction or deletion of this data at any time free of charge. For this purpose, as well as for further questions on the subject of personal data, you can contact us at any time at the address provided in the imprint.
online.desc52: You have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data. For this purpose, you can contact us at any time at the address provided in the imprint. The right to restrict processing exists in the following cases:
online.desc53: • If you contest the accuracy of your personal data stored by us, we usually need time to verify this. For the duration of the verification, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data.
online.desc54: • If the processing of your personal data was/is unlawful, you may request the restriction of data processing instead of deletion.
online.desc55: • If we no longer need your personal data, but you need it to assert, exercise, or defend legal claims, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data instead of deletion.
online.desc56: • If you have objected pursuant to Art. 21 para. 1 GDPR, a balancing of your and our interests must be carried out. As long as it is not yet clear whose interests prevail, you have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data.
online.desc57: If you have restricted the processing of your personal data, this data may – apart from being stored – only be processed with your consent or for the assertion, exercise, or defense of legal claims or for the protection of the rights of another natural or legal person or for reasons of important public interest of the European Union or a member state.
online.desc59: We hereby object to the use of contact data published within the scope of the imprint obligation for sending unsolicited advertising and information materials. The operators of the pages expressly reserve the right to take legal action in the event of the unsolicited sending of advertising information, such as through spam emails.
online.desc61: The websites partially use so-called cookies. Cookies do not damage your computer and do not contain viruses. Cookies serve to make our offer more user-friendly, effective, and secure. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer and saved by your browser.
online.desc62: Most of the cookies we use are so-called 'session cookies.' They are automatically deleted after the end of your visit. Other cookies remain stored on your device until you delete them. These cookies allow us to recognize your browser the next time you visit.
online.desc63: You can set your browser to inform you about the setting of cookies and allow cookies only in individual cases, exclude the acceptance of cookies for certain cases or in general, and activate the automatic deletion of cookies when closing the browser. If cookies are deactivated, the functionality of this website may be limited.
online.desc64: Cookies necessary for carrying out the electronic communication process or for providing certain functions you wish to use (e.g., shopping cart function) are stored based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in storing cookies for the technically error-free and optimized provision of its services. If consent has been requested (e.g., consent to store cookies), the processing is based exclusively on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR; the consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc65: Insofar as other cookies (e.g., cookies for analyzing your browsing behavior) are stored, they are treated separately in this privacy policy.
online.desc67: The provider of the pages automatically collects and stores information in so-called server log files, which your browser automatically transmits to us. These are:
online.desc73: This data is not merged with other data sources.
online.desc74: The collection of this data is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in the technically error-free presentation and optimization of its website – for this purpose, the server log files must be recorded.
online.desc75: Request by email, phone, or fax
online.desc76: If you contact us by email, phone, or fax, your request, including all resulting personal data (name, request) will be stored and processed by us for the purpose of handling your request. We do not share this data without your consent.
online.desc77: The processing of this data is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR, if your request is related to the performance of a contract or is necessary for the implementation of pre-contractual measures. In all other cases, the processing is based on your consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR) and/or on our legitimate interests (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR), as we have a legitimate interest in the effective processing of inquiries addressed to us.
online.desc78: The data you send to us via contact requests remains with us until you request deletion, revoke your consent to storage, or the purpose for data storage no longer applies (e.g., after your request has been processed). Mandatory legal provisions – in particular statutory retention periods – remain unaffected.
online.desc80: You can register on this website to use additional features on the site. The data entered for this purpose will only be used for the purpose of using the respective offer or service for which you have registered. The mandatory information requested during registration must be provided in full. Otherwise, we will reject the registration.
online.desc81: For important changes, such as in the scope of the offer or for technically necessary changes, we will use the email address provided during registration to inform you in this way.
online.desc82: The processing of the data entered during registration is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR, which allows data processing for the performance of a contract or pre-contractual measures.
online.desc83: The data collected during registration will be stored by us as long as you are registered on this website and will be deleted thereafter. Statutory retention periods remain unaffected.
online.desc85: For the comment function on this page, in addition to your comment, information about the time the comment was created, your email address, and, if you are not posting anonymously, the username you have chosen will be saved.
online.desc87: Our comment function stores the IP addresses of users who post comments. Since we do not check comments on this site before they are published, we need this data to take action against the author in case of violations such as insults or propaganda.
online.desc89: As a user of the site, you can subscribe to comments after registration. You will receive a confirmation email to verify that you are the owner of the specified email address. You can unsubscribe from this function at any time via a link in the info emails. The data entered in the course of subscribing to comments will be deleted in this case; if you have transmitted this data to us for other purposes and elsewhere (e.g., newsletter subscription), it will remain with us.
online.desc91: The comments and the associated data (e.g., IP address) are stored and remain on this website until the commented content is completely deleted or the comments must be deleted for legal reasons (e.g., offensive comments).
online.desc92: The storage of comments is based on your consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR). You can revoke any previously given consent at any time. An informal notification via email to us is sufficient. The legality of the data processing already carried out remains unaffected by the revocation.
online.desc93: Processing of data (customer and contract data)
online.desc94: We collect, process, and use personal data only to the extent necessary for the establishment, content arrangement, or modification of the legal relationship (inventory data). This is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. b GDPR, which allows the processing of data to fulfill a contract or pre-contractual measures. We collect, process, and use personal data about the use of this website (usage data) only to the extent necessary to enable the user to use the service or to bill them.
online.desc95: The customer data collected will be deleted after completion of the order or termination of the business relationship. Statutory retention periods remain unaffected.
online.desc97: This website uses features of the web analytics service Google Analytics. The provider is Google Ireland Limited ('Google'), Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland.
online.desc98: Google Analytics uses so-called 'cookies.' These are text files that are stored on your computer and allow an analysis of the use of the website by you. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website is usually transmitted to a Google server in the USA and stored there.
online.desc99: The storage of Google Analytics cookies and the use of this analytics tool are based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in analyzing user behavior to optimize both its web offerings and its advertising. If a corresponding consent has been requested (e.g., consent to store cookies), the processing is based exclusively on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR; the consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc101: We have activated the IP anonymization feature on this website. As a result, your IP address is shortened by Google within member states of the European Union or other contracting states of the Agreement on the European Economic Area before being transmitted to the USA. Only in exceptional cases will the full IP address be transmitted to a Google server in the USA and shortened there. On behalf of the operator of this website, Google will use this information to evaluate your use of the website, compile reports on website activity, and provide other services related to website usage and internet usage to the website operator. The IP address transmitted by your browser as part of Google Analytics will not be merged with other data from Google.
online.desc103: You can prevent the storage of cookies by adjusting your browser software accordingly; however, please note that in this case, you may not be able to fully use all the functions of this website. You can also prevent the collection of data generated by the cookie and related to your use of the website (including your IP address) by Google and the processing of this data by Google by downloading and installing the browser plugin available under the following link: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=de.
online.desc105: You can prevent the collection of your data by Google Analytics by clicking the following link. An opt-out cookie will be set that prevents the collection of your data on future visits to this website: Disable Google Analytics.
online.desc106: More information on how Google Analytics handles user data can be found in Google's privacy policy: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/6004245?hl=de.
online.desc108: We have entered into a contract for order processing with Google and fully implement the strict requirements of the German data protection authorities when using Google Analytics.
online.desc110: This website uses the 'demographic features' function of Google Analytics. This allows reports to be generated that contain statements about the age, gender, and interests of the site visitors. This data comes from interest-based advertising by Google as well as visitor data from third-party providers. This data cannot be attributed to a specific person. You can disable this feature at any time through the ad settings in your Google account or prohibit the collection of your data by Google Analytics as described in the 'Objection to Data Collection' section.
online.desc112: Data stored by Google at the user and event level, linked to cookies, user IDs (e.g., User ID), or advertising IDs (e.g., DoubleClick cookies, Android advertising ID), will be anonymized or deleted after 26 months. Details can be found at the following link: https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/7667196?hl=de
online.desc114: This website uses Hotjar. The provider is Hotjar Ltd., Level 2, St Julians Business Centre, 3, Elia Zammit Street, St Julians STJ 1000, Malta, Europe (Website: https://www.hotjar.com).
online.desc115: We can also determine how long you stayed on a page and when you left it. We can also determine where you abandoned your input in a contact form (so-called conversion funnels).
online.desc116: In addition, Hotjar can be used to directly gather feedback from website visitors. This function helps improve the offerings of the website operator.
online.desc117: Hotjar uses cookies. Cookies are small text files stored on your computer and saved by your browser. They make our offering more user-friendly, effective, and secure. These cookies allow us to detect whether this website was visited by a particular device or whether the functions of Hotjar have been deactivated for the respective browser. Hotjar cookies remain on your device until you delete them.
online.desc118: You can adjust your browser settings to inform you about the setting of cookies and allow cookies only in individual cases, exclude the acceptance of cookies for certain cases or generally, and enable the automatic deletion of cookies when closing the browser. If cookies are disabled, the functionality of this website may be limited.
online.desc119: The use of Hotjar and the storage of Hotjar cookies are based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in analyzing user behavior to optimize both its web offerings and its advertising. If consent has been requested (e.g., consent to store cookies), the processing is based exclusively on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR; the consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc121: If you want to deactivate Hotjar data collection, click the following link and follow the instructions: https://www.hotjar.com/opt-out
online.desc122: Please note that Hotjar must be deactivated separately for each browser or device.
online.desc123: For more information about Hotjar and the data it collects, please refer to Hotjar's privacy policy at the following link: https://www.hotjar.com/privacy
online.desc125: We have entered into an order processing contract with Hotjar to implement the strict European data protection regulations.
online.desc127: This website uses Google Analytics Remarketing in conjunction with the cross-device features of Google AdWords and Google DoubleClick. The provider is Google Ireland Limited ('Google'), Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland.
online.desc128: This function allows the advertising target groups created with Google Analytics Remarketing to be linked to the cross-device capabilities of Google AdWords and Google DoubleClick. In this way, interest-based, personalized advertising messages that have been adapted based on your previous usage and browsing behavior on one device (e.g., mobile phone) can also be displayed on one of your other devices (e.g., tablet or PC).
online.desc129: If you have given the appropriate consent, Google will link your web and app browsing history with your Google account for this purpose. This allows the same personalized advertising messages to be displayed on every device on which you log in with your Google account.
online.desc130: To support this feature, Google Analytics collects google-authenticated IDs of users, which are temporarily linked to our Google Analytics data to define and create target audiences for cross-device advertising.
online.desc131: You can permanently opt out of cross-device remarketing/targeting by disabling personalized advertising in your Google account; follow this link: https://www.google.com/settings/ads/onweb/
online.desc132: The aggregation of data collected in your Google account is based solely on your consent, which you can give or revoke at Google (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR). For data collection processes that are not aggregated in your Google account (e.g., because you do not have a Google account or have objected to aggregation), the data collection is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The legitimate interest arises from the fact that the website operator has an interest in the anonymized analysis of website visitors for advertising purposes.
online.desc133: Further information and the privacy policy can be found in Google's privacy policy at: https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads?hl=de.
online.desc134: Google AdWords and Google Conversion Tracking
online.desc135: This website uses Google AdWords. AdWords is an online advertising program of Google Ireland Limited (“Google”), Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland.
online.desc136: As part of Google AdWords, we use what is known as conversion tracking. When you click on an ad served by Google, a cookie for conversion tracking is set. Cookies are small text files that the internet browser places on the user's computer. These cookies expire after 30 days and do not serve for personal identification of users. If the user visits certain pages of this website and the cookie has not yet expired, Google and we can recognize that the user clicked on the ad and was redirected to this page.
online.desc137: Each Google AdWords customer receives a different cookie. The cookies cannot be tracked across the websites of AdWords customers. The information obtained through the conversion cookie is used to create conversion statistics for AdWords customers who opted for conversion tracking. The customers are informed of the total number of users who clicked on their ad and were redirected to a page marked with a conversion tracking tag. However, they do not receive any information that would allow personal identification of users. If you do not wish to participate in tracking, you can object to this use by easily deactivating the Google conversion tracking cookie through your internet browser under user settings. You will then not be included in the conversion tracking statistics.
online.desc138: The storage of conversion cookies and the use of this tracking tool are based on Article 6 (1) lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in analyzing user behavior to optimize both their web offerings and advertising. If consent was requested (e.g., consent for cookie storage), processing is carried out solely on the basis of Article 6 (1) lit. a GDPR; consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc139: For more information on Google AdWords and Google Conversion Tracking, please refer to Google's privacy policy: https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en.
online.desc140: You can set your browser to inform you about the setting of cookies and allow cookies only in individual cases, exclude the acceptance of cookies for specific cases or generally, and activate the automatic deletion of cookies when closing the browser. If you disable cookies, the functionality of this website may be limited.
online.desc142: This website uses the visitor action pixel from Facebook for conversion measurement, Facebook Inc., 1601 S. California Ave, Palo Alto, CA 94304, USA (“Facebook”).
online.desc143: This allows the behavior of site visitors to be tracked after they are redirected to the provider's website by clicking on a Facebook ad. This allows the effectiveness of Facebook ads to be evaluated for statistical and market research purposes and future advertising measures to be optimized.
online.desc144: The data collected is anonymous for us as the operator of this website; we cannot draw conclusions about the identity of the users. However, the data is stored and processed by Facebook, so a connection to the respective user profile is possible, and Facebook can use the data for its own advertising purposes, in accordance with the Facebook Data Use Policy. This allows Facebook to place ads on Facebook's pages as well as outside of Facebook. This use of the data cannot be influenced by us as the page operator.
online.desc145: The use of Facebook Pixel is based on Article 6 (1) lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in effective advertising measures, including social media. If consent was requested (e.g., consent for cookie storage), processing is carried out solely on the basis of Article 6 (1) lit. a GDPR; consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc146: In Facebook's privacy policy, you will find further information on protecting your privacy: https://www.facebook.com/about/privacy/.
online.desc147: You can also deactivate the remarketing function 'Custom Audiences' in the ad settings area at https://www.facebook.com/ads/preferences/?entry_product=ad_settings_screen. You must be logged into Facebook to do this.
online.desc148: If you do not have a Facebook account, you can disable Facebook's usage-based advertising on the website of the European Interactive Digital Advertising Alliance: http://www.youronlinechoices.com/de/praferenzmanagement/.
online.desc150: We use the services of OneSignal, 2194 Esperanca Avenue, Santa Clara, CA 95054 (hereinafter 'OneSignal'), to send you push notifications if you have consented to receive them by granting the corresponding permission. OneSignal receives information when you visit our site and confirm the push notification, such as the temporary unique device ID, the current location linked with the temporary unique device ID; your email address (if provided), your IP address, type of device, type and version of your operating system, your mobile provider, your language settings, time zone, and network settings (e.g., WiFi). You can find the privacy information and further details from OneSignal, including OneSignal's privacy policy here: https://onesignal.com/privacy_policy.
online.desc151: The legal basis for data processing for these purposes is Article 6 (1) lit. f GDPR.
online.desc153: We use the services of getsitecontrol.com. On our site, information is displayed in the form of overlapping windows. For the display of these so-called widgets, we use the service GetSiteControl, provided by GetWebCraft Limited, Klimentos 41-43, Klimentos Tower, Flat/Office 25, 1061, Nicosia, Cyprus. The display of information occurs based on certain rules, such as dwell time or the call of certain subpages, so that to display correctly, this information is collected via a cookie. This data processing takes place due to our legitimate interest in optimal marketing of our online offering under Article 6 (1) f) GDPR.
online.desc154: For more information on data protection at GetWebCraft, please refer to the company's privacy policy: getsitecontrol.com/privacy/.
online.desc156: We use the web analytics service Trackboxx on our site. We statistically evaluate visitor access and analyze the use of our online presence. The data is stored anonymously on a server in Germany for this purpose and is subject to the GDPR requirements.
online.desc157: We do not use any cookies or store personal data. Rather, your IP address is used to generate a code, which is then assigned to an anonymous user ID while you are on our website. This data cannot be assigned to a specific person and is encrypted with a daily changing code. Thus, it is also not possible to 'recognize' you on a return visit to our website.
online.desc158: Cross-site tracking, linking the data with other sources, or passing on the information to third parties does not occur.
online.desc159: The legal basis for processing is Article 6 (1) lit. f GDPR. Our legitimate interest lies in the needs-based design and optimization of our online presence.
online.desc160: If you still do not wish to help us improve our site, you can control this at any time through the 'Do-Not-Track' function in your browser. We have summarized links here on how to do this for the most common browser types:
online.desc165: If you want to receive the newsletter offered on the website, we need your email address and information that allows us to verify that you are the owner of the provided email address and that you agree to receive the newsletter. No further data will be collected, or only on a voluntary basis. We use this data solely for sending the requested information and do not share it with third parties.
online.desc166: The processing of the data entered in the newsletter registration form is carried out solely on the basis of your consent (Article 6 (1) lit. a GDPR). You can revoke the consent given for the storage of data, the email address, and its use for sending the newsletter at any time, for example, through the 'Unsubscribe' link in the newsletter. The lawfulness of the data processing already carried out remains unaffected by the revocation.
online.desc167: The data you provided for receiving the newsletter will be stored by us until you unsubscribe from the newsletter or the newsletter service provider and will be deleted from the newsletter distribution list after unsubscribing. Data that has been stored for other purposes remains unaffected.
online.desc168: After you unsubscribe from the newsletter distribution list, your email address will be stored by us or the newsletter service provider in a blacklist to prevent future mailings. The data from the blacklist will only be used for this purpose and will not be merged with other data. This serves both your interest and our interest in complying with the legal requirements for sending newsletters (legitimate interest under Article 6 (1) lit. f GDPR). The storage in the blacklist is not time-limited. You can object to the storage if your interests outweigh our legitimate interest.
online.desc170: This website uses the services of MailChimp for sending newsletters. The provider is Rocket Science Group LLC, 675 Ponce De Leon Ave NE, Suite 5000, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA.
online.desc171: MailChimp is a service that allows organizing and analyzing the sending of newsletters. If you enter data for the purpose of subscribing to the newsletter (e.g., email address), this data will be stored on MailChimp's servers in the USA.
online.desc172: MailChimp has certification under the 'EU-US Privacy Shield.' The 'Privacy Shield' is an agreement between the European Union (EU) and the USA that aims to ensure compliance with European data protection standards in the USA.
online.desc173: With MailChimp, we can analyze our newsletter campaigns. When you open an email sent via MailChimp, a file contained in the email (so-called web beacon) connects to MailChimp's servers in the USA. This allows determining whether a newsletter message was opened and which links may have been clicked. Additionally, technical information is collected (e.g., time of retrieval, IP address, browser type, and operating system). This information cannot be assigned to the respective newsletter recipient. It serves solely for the statistical analysis of newsletter campaigns. The results of these analyses can be used to better tailor future newsletters to the recipients' interests.
online.desc174: If you do not want analysis by MailChimp, you must unsubscribe from the newsletter. We provide a corresponding link in each newsletter message.
online.desc175: Data processing is based on your consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR). You can revoke this consent at any time by unsubscribing from the newsletter. The legality of already completed data processing operations remains unaffected by the revocation.
online.desc176: The data you provided for the purpose of subscribing to the newsletter will be stored by us until you unsubscribe from the newsletter or the newsletter service provider, and will be deleted from the newsletter distribution list after unsubscribing. Data that has been stored for other purposes remains unaffected.
online.desc177: After you unsubscribe from the newsletter distribution list, your email address may be stored by us or the newsletter service provider in a blacklist to prevent future mailings. The data from the blacklist will only be used for this purpose and will not be merged with other data. This serves both your interest and our interest in complying with legal requirements when sending newsletters (legitimate interest according to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR). The storage in the blacklist is not time-limited. You can object to the storage if your interests outweigh our legitimate interests.
online.desc178: For more details, please refer to MailChimp's privacy policy at: https://mailchimp.com/legal/terms/
online.desc179: Conclusion of a Data Processing Agreement
online.desc180: We have concluded a so-called 'Data Processing Agreement' with MailChimp, in which we require MailChimp to protect our customers' data and not to share it with third parties.
online.desc182: This website integrates videos from YouTube. The operator of the website is Google Ireland Limited ('Google'), Gordon House, Barrow Street, Dublin 4, Ireland.
online.desc183: When you visit one of our web pages that includes YouTube, a connection is established to YouTube's servers. In this process, YouTube is informed of which of our pages you have visited.
online.desc184: Furthermore, YouTube may store various cookies on your device. These cookies allow YouTube to receive information about visitors to this website. This information is used to collect video statistics, improve user-friendliness, and prevent fraud attempts. The cookies remain on your device until you delete them.
online.desc185: If you are logged into your YouTube account, YouTube can directly associate your surfing behavior with your personal profile. You can prevent this by logging out of your YouTube account.
online.desc186: The use of YouTube is in the interest of an appealing presentation of our online offerings. This represents a legitimate interest according to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. If consent has been requested (e.g., consent to the storage of cookies), the processing is carried out solely on the basis of Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR; the consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc187: For more information on handling user data, please refer to YouTube's privacy policy at: https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en.
online.desc189: This website uses plugins from the video portal Vimeo. The provider is Vimeo Inc., 555 West 18th Street, New York, New York 10011, USA.
online.desc190: When you visit one of our pages equipped with a Vimeo plugin, a connection to Vimeo's servers is established. This informs the Vimeo server of which of our pages you have visited. Additionally, Vimeo obtains your IP address. This applies even if you are not logged into Vimeo or do not have an account with Vimeo. The information collected by Vimeo is transmitted to the Vimeo server in the USA.
online.desc191: If you are logged into your Vimeo account, Vimeo can directly associate your surfing behavior with your personal profile. You can prevent this by logging out of your Vimeo account.
online.desc192: The use of Vimeo is in the interest of an appealing presentation of our online offerings. This represents a legitimate interest according to Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. If consent has been requested (e.g., consent to the storage of cookies), the processing is carried out solely on the basis of Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR; the consent can be revoked at any time.
online.desc193: For more information on handling user data, please refer to Vimeo's privacy policy at: https://vimeo.com/privacy.
online.desc195: This website may integrate plugins from the social network SoundCloud (SoundCloud Limited, Berners House, 47-48 Berners Street, London W1T 3NF, UK). You can recognize the SoundCloud plugins by the SoundCloud logo on the affected pages.
online.desc196: When you visit this website, a direct connection is established between your browser and the SoundCloud server after activating the plugin. This provides SoundCloud with the information that you have visited this website with your IP address. If you click the 'Like' or 'Share' button while logged into your SoundCloud account, you can link and/or share the content of this website with your SoundCloud profile. This allows SoundCloud to associate your visit to this website with your user account. We would like to point out that as the provider of the pages, we have no knowledge of the content of the transmitted data and how SoundCloud uses it.
online.desc197: The use of SoundCloud is based on Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in maximizing visibility in social media.
online.desc198: For more information, please refer to SoundCloud's privacy policy at: https://soundcloud.com/pages/privacy.
online.desc199: If you do not wish for SoundCloud to associate your visit to this website with your SoundCloud user account, please log out of your SoundCloud user account before activating content from the SoundCloud plugin.
online.desc201: The operators of this website participate in the Amazon EU Partner Program. Advertising and links to the Amazon.de website are integrated into this website, through which we can earn money through advertising reimbursement. Amazon uses cookies for this purpose to track the origin of the orders. This allows Amazon to recognize that you clicked the affiliate link on this website.
online.desc202: The storage of 'Amazon cookies' is based on Art. 6 lit. f GDPR. The website operator has a legitimate interest in this, as only through the cookies can the amount of their affiliate remuneration be determined.
online.desc203: For more information on data usage by Amazon, please refer to Amazon's privacy policy: https://www.amazon.de/gp/help/customer/display.html/ref=footer_privacy?ie=UTF8&nodeId=3312401.
online.desc205: Those who engage in day trading or swing trading require a specialized online broker. We have established affiliate partnerships with several brokers. If a potential client comes to the online broker's website via our affiliate link and opens an account there, we receive an affiliate remuneration from the broker under certain conditions. It is also possible for the broker to provide us with the contact details of the client we referred. Our current affiliate partners are: FXFlat, GBE Brokers, XTB, ColmexPro.
online.desc207: Some of our products, services, and content are offered by Digistore24 as a reseller. The provider and contractual partner is Digistore24 GmbH, St.-Godehard-Straße 32, 31139 Hildesheim. What data Digistore24 stores and processes during this website visit is outlined by Digistore24 GmbH as the data controller in its own privacy policy. More information can be found in the Digistore24 privacy policy: https://www.digistore24.com/dataschutz.
online.desc209: The WordPress plugin provides the ability to integrate various Digistore24 services on your own website, such as the social proof bubble, affiliate ad generator, or other tools.
online.desc210: During each integration, non-personal data is loaded from the Digistore24 server (e.g., a JavaScript file).
online.desc211: During this loading, your web browser retrieves a webpage from the Digistore24 server. Our server has no influence on the extent to which your web browser transmits data to the Digistore24 server. Our server itself does not transmit any data to the Digistore24 servers in this context.
online.desc213: Digistore24 provides the ability to integrate various services on your own website through HTML and JavaScript codes, such as the social proof bubble or the Digistore24 shopping cart.
online.desc214: During each integration, non-personal data is loaded from the Digistore24 server (e.g., a JavaScript file).
online.desc215: During this loading, your web browser retrieves a webpage from the Digistore24 server. Our server has no influence on the extent to which your web browser transmits data to the Digistore24 server. Our server itself does not transmit any data to the Digistore24 servers in this context.
online.desc216: What data Digistore24 stores and processes during this website visit is outlined by Digistore24 GmbH as the data controller in its own privacy policy. You can find the Digistore24 privacy policy here: https://www.digistore24.com/dataschutz.
online.desc218: On this website, we use various links to offers from Digistore24. The purpose of the links is to draw your attention to products that may be of interest to you.
online.desc219: Some of these links point to the domain digistore24.com of Digistore24 GmbH.
online.desc220: When you click on one of the links, you are accessing a webpage on the Digistore24 server.
online.desc221: Our server does not transmit any data to Digistore24 in this process; rather, the data is transmitted from your web browser to Digistore24 as with any webpage visit. We have no influence on the extent to which your web browser transmits data to Digistore24.
online.desc222: Please refer to the Digistore24 privacy policy for further information on the scope of data collected by Digistore24 from website visits: https://www.digistore24.com/dataschutz.
online.desc223: For our webinar offerings, we use the services of Webinaris GmbH, Bussardstr. 5, 82166 Gräfelfing. § 1 Purpose Webinaris collects, processes, and stores your personal data to enable and optimize the use of the services offered by Webinaris. Webinaris uses the collected data for contract fulfillment and advertising purposes. § 2 Data Collection I. Webinaris collects, processes, and stores personal data that the user provides or that is generated by Webinaris. Different data is collected from providers of webinars and participants or interested parties for webinars.
online.desc224: When registering for a webinar, contact details such as first name, last name, and email address, the respective IP address with timestamp, and data resulting from the use of Webinaris (activity data), the status, the request that the user's browser made to the server, the transmitted data volume, as well as the webpage from which the user arrived at the requested page (referrer) and the product and version information of the browser used (user agent) are stored. All other data entered by the user is also stored.
online.desc225: Additionally, the double opt-in process is recorded by the providers to later demonstrate that the participant has registered and has not received unsolicited emails. Providers may also store additional data that the participant enters in the customized question field provided by the respective webinar provider. This data is stored by Webinaris as long as the provider does not delete it. Even after deletion by the provider, it is conceivable that this data may still exist in a security file at Webinaris.
online.desc226: Furthermore, user logs are stored, meaning it is recorded and stored whether and, if so, how long and at what time a participant has attended a webinar for which they previously registered.
online.desc227: II. The user is informed during registration whether answering the questions is mandatory or voluntary. § 3 Particularly Sensitive Personal Data I. Webinaris will not process personal data that reveals racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or union membership, as well as data about health or sexual life on its own initiative; unless the affected user has publicly disclosed this data or explicitly consented to its processing. Webinaris informs webinar providers that they should not process personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or union membership, as well as data about health or sexual life, unless the affected user has publicly disclosed this data or explicitly consented to its processing. However, if a webinar provider processes particularly sensitive personal data without either exception applying, such data will automatically also be stored at Webinaris, but not processed. This results from the fact that all data stored by webinar providers on Webinaris is stored on the Webinaris server.
online.desc228: II. If one of the exceptions applies under which the processing of the above-mentioned particularly sensitive personal data is exceptionally permissible, Webinaris will only share this data with the explicit consent of the affected user with other users or third parties. Disclosure of this data by the user is always voluntary and can be revoked at any time. § 4 Recipients of the Data and Use by Third Parties I. The initial recipient of the data is Webinaris itself. Webinaris does not use the data of webinar participants and/or interested parties for its own advertising purposes.
online.desc229: II. In addition, the providers of webinars are also recipients of participant data, particularly information about whether, how long, and when a participant has attended a webinar.
online.desc230: III. The providers, but not Webinaris itself, may use participant data for context-based or behavioral advertising. For this purpose, user data is used or passed on for the most precise targeting of advertising. Furthermore, participant data may also be used by the providers for other advertising and market research purposes.
online.desc231: Webinaris uses the data of its customers, the providers, but not of their customers, the participants, potentially for context-based or behavioral advertising. For this purpose, data of the providers is used or passed on for the most precise targeting of advertising. Furthermore, data of the providers may also be used for other advertising and market research purposes.
online.desc232: IV. Finally, recipients of the data also include third parties, particularly Digistore24. Webinaris also involves freelancers who have access to user data to fulfill their respective tasks.
online.desc233: V. In the event that Webinaris is sold entirely or partially, or another legal successor occurs, the data will also be passed on to the respective legal successor.
online.desc234: VI. Personal data will be disclosed to state investigative and judicial authorities upon request, while observing the legal regulations. § 5 Data of Former Users If a user is blocked from Webinaris, their data will continue to be processed to the extent necessary to prevent another registration. Furthermore, Webinaris complies with legal retention requirements. § 6 Cookies “Cookies” are small files that allow specific information related to the user to be stored on computers or other devices while the user is using Webinaris. This includes, in particular, so-called “session cookies,” which allow the user to be identified during the time they have accessed Webinaris. At the end of the session, parts of the user’s registration data are stored in encrypted form so that Webinaris can recognize the user on their next visit.
online.desc235: Webinaris works with the online retailer Digistore24. This, in turn, builds affiliates for Webinaris who promote Webinaris. To track whether a user became aware of Webinaris through a specific affiliate, they also use cookies.
online.desc236: Users can disable the storage of cookies in their browser, limit it to certain websites, or set their browser to notify them whenever a cookie is sent. Users also have the option to delete cookies from their hard drive. Webinaris informs users that the Webinaris services may not function properly or fully if cookies are rejected. § 7 Right to Information Users have the right to receive the following information from Webinaris:
online.desc237: I. freely and unhindered at reasonable intervals without unreasonable delay or excessive costs,
online.desc238: 1. confirmation that there are or are not processes concerning their data, as well as information about the purposes of these processes, the categories of data concerned, the categories of recipients to whom the data has been disclosed, the planned duration of the storage, the rights to rectification and erasure, the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, and if the data is not collected from the user, any available information about the source of this data,
online.desc239: 2. data about the personal data processed concerning them, as well as information regarding the processing of their personal data,
online.desc240: II. Users can request this information by contacting Webinaris directly via email or mail. § 8 Data Protection Rights Users have the following rights regarding their data:
online.desc241: I. Right to rectification Users can request that inaccurate or incomplete personal data concerning them be corrected or completed.
online.desc242: II. Right to erasure Users can request that personal data concerning them be deleted if the data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected or if they have withdrawn their consent upon which the processing is based.
online.desc243: III. Right to restriction of processing Users can request that the processing of their personal data be restricted.
online.desc244: IV. Right to data portability Users can request to receive their personal data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and have the right to transmit those data to another controller without hindrance from the controller to whom the personal data have been provided.
online.desc245: V. Right to lodge a complaint Users can lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority if they believe that the processing of their personal data violates applicable law.
online.desc246: VI. Users can exercise their rights directly with Webinaris. § 9 Data Security Webinaris uses appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect personal data against accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure, or access. § 10 Changes to the Privacy Policy Webinaris reserves the right to change this privacy policy at any time, provided this is legally permissible. Users will be informed about changes to this privacy policy in good time and, if applicable, will have the opportunity to consent to the changes.
online.desc247: We encourage you to review the privacy policy of Webinaris regularly to stay informed about how we protect your data. § 11 SMSFactor
online.impressum9: Register entry: Registered in the Commercial Register
online.impressum15: Online dispute resolution according to Art. 14 Abs. 1 ODR-VO: The European Commission provides a platform for online dispute resolution (OS), which customers can find at http://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr/.
online.impressum17: The contents of the website were created with the utmost care and to the best of our knowledge. However, the provider of this website does not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of the provided pages and content.
online.impressum18: As a service provider, the provider of this website is responsible for its own content and provided information on these pages according to § 7 Abs. 1 TMG; however, according to §§ 8 to 10 TMG, they are not obligated to monitor transmitted or stored foreign information. The removal or blocking of such content will occur immediately upon knowledge of a specific infringement. Liability is only possible from the moment of gaining knowledge.
online.impressum19: Claims for damages against the provider, which relate to material or immaterial damages caused by the use or non-use of the provided information or by the use of incorrect and incomplete information, are fundamentally excluded, unless the author has demonstrably acted with intent or gross negligence. All offers are subject to change and non-binding. The provider expressly reserves the right to change, supplement, delete parts of the pages or the entire offer without prior notice or to cease publication temporarily or permanently.
online.impressum21: The website contains so-called 'external links' (links) to other websites, over whose content the provider of this website has no influence. For this reason, the provider cannot accept any liability for these contents. The respective provider of the linked website is responsible for the content and accuracy of the provided information. At the time of linking, no legal violations were recognizable. Upon becoming aware of such legal violations, the link will be removed immediately.
online.impressum23: The contents, works, and information published on this website are subject to German copyright and performance protection rights. Any kind of reproduction, editing, distribution, storage, and any type of exploitation beyond the limits of copyright requires the prior written consent of the respective rights holder. Unauthorized copying/storing of the provided information on these websites is not permitted and punishable.
online.impressum24: 4. Legal Effect of this Liability Disclaimer
online.impressum25: This liability disclaimer is to be regarded as part of the internet offering from which reference was made to this page. If parts or individual formulations of this text do not, no longer, or not completely correspond to the applicable legal situation, the remaining parts of the document remain unaffected in their content and validity. online.risiki3: Direct Daytrading GmbH, represented by the managing director Georg Hierstetter, Donaustaufer Str. 200, in 93059 Regensburg (hereinafter referred to as 'NextLevelTrading' or 'Provider') offers an educational concept on the website www.nextleveltrading.com (hereinafter referred to as 'Offer').
online.risiki4: The content of the blog serves solely for entertainment and personal further education. Readers or subscribers who make investment decisions or carry out transactions based on the published content or information from the provider act entirely at their own risk. The provider does not make any recommendations. Any opinions or other information contained on this page are provided as general market commentary and do not constitute investment advice.
online.risiki5: The provider obtains information from sources that they consider reliable. No guarantee regarding the quality and truthfulness of this information can be given and cannot be taken.
online.risiki6: NextLevelTrading assumes no liability for the trading suggestions and information provided. These in no way constitute an invitation to replicate individually or generally, not even implicitly. Trading suggestions or other information do not constitute an invitation to buy or sell securities or derivative financial products. Liability for indirect and direct consequences of the published content and information is thus excluded.
online.risiki7: NextLevelTrading is not responsible for losses or damages, including but not limited to any lost profits, that arise directly or indirectly from trading activities based on this information. Tradingfreaks.com has taken sufficient measures to ensure the accuracy of the information on the website.
online.risiki8: Changes to the content of this website are reserved at any time and without prior notice.
online.risiki9: Stock, index, Forex currency, and CFD trading on margin involves a high risk and is therefore not suitable for every investor. Before considering the services and products of various brokers for derivative trading, you should carefully consider your investment goals, financial circumstances, needs, as well as your level of experience and knowledge.
online.risiki10: By trading and speculating with currencies, you could incur a partial or complete loss of your deposited funds with various brokers and should therefore not speculate with capital that you cannot afford to lose. Be aware of all the risks associated with derivative trading, particularly the possible obligation to cover losses with the respective brokers. Tradingfreaks.com recommends consulting an independent financial advisor.
online.risiki11: NextLevelTrading points out the particularly high risks in transactions with options, derivatives, and derivative financial instruments. Trading with options, CFDs, or derivatives is a financial futures transaction. The significant opportunities of financial futures transactions are accompanied by corresponding risks, which can not only lead to a total loss of the invested capital but also result in further losses that could lead to a demand for additional payment beyond the invested capital. If you do not meet the required margin, your position may be liquidated; you alone are responsible for any resulting losses. The use of an internet-based trading system carries risks, including but not limited to hardware, software, and internet connection failures.
online.risiki12: For this reason, this type of transaction requires in-depth and well-founded knowledge regarding financial products, financial instruments, and other tradable products, trading techniques and strategies on the securities markets.
online.risiki13: Only consumers who have read and understood the brochure 'Basic Information about Financial Futures' available at banks and savings banks according to § 37d WpHG and have read and signed the form 'Important Information about the Loss Risks of Financial Futures Transactions' are entitled to participate in trading options and other financial futures transactions. The customer acts at their own risk and peril.
online.risiki15: Due to the leverage effect, disproportionate losses can occur. Please note that futures trading is subject to value and price fluctuations of the underlying assets. After trading suspensions, in volatile market phases, and between closing and opening prices, price changes can occur that may exceed the loss of the invested capital.
online.risiki17: Margin trading includes transactions based on the price movements of a product. The settlement is based on the difference between the opening and closing price of the transaction. Margin trading is only suitable for experienced investors with a high risk tolerance. There is a danger that you will lose more capital than you originally invested. Margin trading can lead to total losses and obligations to cover losses.
online.risiki18: Risk Notice Market, Stock Analyses and Articles
online.risiki19: Market, stock analyses, or articles are for informational purposes only. They do not constitute an offer or a recommendation to open a broker account, to use a service, or to buy or sell financial instruments. Information on realized and potential gains in the past does not guarantee future profits.

faqs.question: Why is the training free?
faqs.answer: It is important for us to say that membership and training are 100% free. Our broker partner covers the costs, so you don't have to pay anything. We work with one of the world's leading and multiple award-winning trading platforms that sponsors our service and finances your membership. As long as you use their platform, we can offer our service completely free to all members. This creates a true win-win situation – and that is precisely why we have become so popular in recent years and have developed into a globally recognized trading brand.

faqs.question: Do I need experience in trading?
faqs.answer: You do not need any prior experience in trading. We guide you step-by-step into the subject with our trading PDF. With the course, we ensure that we provide beginners with the right knowledge, appropriate infrastructure, and a strategy to trade profitably in the market over the long term; additionally, there is direct free coaching with a trading expert.

faqs.question: How much time do I need to invest in trading?
faqs.answer: As a profitable trader, you do not need to sit in front of the charts all day. Most of our members spend only 30 to 60 minutes a day trading. Our concepts offer strategies for every time, which is ideal for working professionals and busy individuals. The most important thing: You neither have to trade daily nor invest several hours. With our help, trading will naturally be integrated into your everyday life.

faqs.question: Is the trading education useful for advanced traders?
faqs.answer: The course is primarily aimed at trading beginners. However, some individual modules may still be helpful for advanced traders.

faqs.question: Is there active support?
faqs.answer: Through our free trading PDF, we already save some resources to convey the most important experiences. However, we have realized that it is beneficial for each new partner to have an initial conversation with a trading expert to succeed. Should you need further assistance afterwards, we are, of course, at your disposal at any time.

data.title: Complete Financial Independence
data.description: Build a second source of income, become long-term independent from your employer, and secure a higher standard of living.

data.title: Break Your Income Limits
data.description: As a trader, your income is no longer subject to artificial limits. With this ability, you have full control over your income.

data.title: Live by Your Rules
data.description: Enjoy a life without restrictions. You trade wherever and whenever you want – it doesn't matter if you're at home or traveling the world.

data.title: Earn in Every Market Situation
data.description: Day traders benefit from both rising and falling prices. With our TF method, you can generate profits independent of the market.
